meanings.sent1: She nonconcurred with the decision to close the park early.
meanings.sent2: The jury nonconcurred on the final verdict, leading to a hung jury.
meanings.sent3: The cat nonconcurred with the new brand of food, turning its nose up at it.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness nonconcurred with any suggestions for improvement.
meanings.sent5: The student nonconcurred with the teacher's grading of the assignment, feeling it was unfair.

meanings.definition: Not concurring or agreeing with others
meanings.sent1: Her nonconcurred opinion stood out among the group of friends.
meanings.sent2: The nonconcurred decision caused tension within the team.
meanings.sent3: The nonconcurred viewpoint added an interesting dynamic to the discussion.
meanings.sent4: His nonconcurred stance on the issue made him a unique voice in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The nonconcurred belief challenged the status quo and sparked a debate.
